subject: Real Estate
title: The High Line: Railroad to Real Estate Gold
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The High Line: Railroad to Real Estate Gold.

hook.text: An abandoned elevated railroad in New York became a park. Property around it skyrocketed in value.

buildup.text: The High Line opened in 2009 as a 1.45-mile linear park on Manhattan's West Side.

discovery.text: Within five years, the park attracted $2 billion in new development along its route.

twist.text: Rising prices displaced the artists and residents who fought to save the railroad in the first place.

climax.text: The High Line became both a model of creative urban renewal and a cautionary tale about green gentrification.

punchline.text: A park that saved a neighborhood also priced it out.

quiz.question: What unintended consequence did the High Line create?
